intro: Zosima subscaposa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zosima, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Zosima subscaposa is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
